headline: Nvidia–xAI boosts chip stocks, Equifax strikes back against FICO
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman outlines three of Wednesday's top stories on Wall Street as part of Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Chip stocks continue to rise on Bloomberg reports — now confirmed by Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang — that Nvidia is among the investors financing the latest funding round for Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk's artificial intelligence (AI) company, xAI (XAAI.PVT). Equifax (EFX) stock surges after the company cut its credit score data prices, striking back against FICO (FICO). AST Spacemobile (ASTS) stock skyrockets on news of the company's deal with Verizon (VZ). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Nvidia Stock Rises on Report It’s Investing in Elon Musk’s xAI
summary: Nvidia  stock was rising early Wednesday.  The leading AI chip maker was on track to snap a three-day losing streak after a report that it could invest in Elon Musk’s xAI.  Nvidia is one of the backers, and could invest as much as $2 billion in the privately held AI start-up, according to Bloomberg, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

raw.headline: Nvidia Stock Rises on Report It’s Investing in Elon Musk’s xAI
raw.summary: Nvidia  stock was rising early Wednesday.  The leading AI chip maker was on track to snap a three-day losing streak after a report that it could invest in Elon Musk’s xAI.  Nvidia is one of the backers, and could invest as much as $2 billion in the privately held AI start-up, according to Bloomberg, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

headline: Cisco rolls out chip designed to connect AI data centers over vast distances
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Cisco Systems launched on Wednesday a new networking chip designed to connect artificial intelligence data centers, with the cloud computing units of Microsoft and Alibaba enrolling as the chip's customers.  The P200 chip, as Cisco calls it, will compete against rival offerings from Broadcom.  It will sit at the heart of a new routing device that the company also rolled out on Wednesday and is designed to connect the sprawling data centers that are located over vast distances and which train AI systems.

headline: The AI Bubble Is Here. 9 Stocks to Play It.
summary: Seaport Global analyst Jay  Goldberg is firmly in the bubble camp.  While chips are a critical part of the AI chain, he’s not sure that the business cycles are synced: “So saying that ASML,  Applied Materials Lam Research  and  KLA  are AI stories is a bit of stretch, but AI is definitely one of many important drivers of their business.”

headline: Goldman’s Oppenheimer Dismisses Bubble Fears in US Tech Stocks
summary: “Valuations of the technology sector are becoming stretched but not yet at levels consistent with historical bubbles,” Oppenheimer and his team wrote in a note.  Still, the strategist reiterated his recommendation that investors seek diversification to avoid risks around a narrow US stock rally and higher competition in the artificial intelligence space.

raw.headline: Goldman’s Oppenheimer Dismisses Bubble Fears in US Tech Stocks
